titlestmt.titleproper: Advisory Council on College Chemistry records 1963-1970
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Advisory Council on College Chemistry records

bioghist.p: The Advisory Council on College Chemistry (ACCC) was formed in 1962 as an effort to improve college chemistry instruction. The program sought support for experimental programs, and formed study groups on general chemistry, curriculum and advanced courses, teaching aids, teacher development and courses for non-scientists. The ACCC was sponsored by the National Science Foundation from 1962 to 1968.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records from the Advisory Council on College Chemistry. Materials include: documents relating to the founding of the ACCC; newsletters (1963-1970); project ideas and opinion papers; reports from the Executive, Curriculum, and Teaching Aids Committees and from Regional Conferences; project progress reports; and financial records.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
